transcript.text: There are many things to consider before offering or receiving gifts or entertainment. Click on each heading to learn more.

contentText.text: When thinking about gifts and entertainment, you should always consider the following:

instructionText.text: Select each heading. To read the next, click the X to close the text box.
Click on Next (bottom right arrow) to continue.

popText.text: Ask yourself: “How much is it worth?”
Excessive or extravagant gifts can send the wrong message, so they’re rarely, if ever, appropriate.
Keep gifts customary and reasonable for the circumstances, and document all gifts accurately and honestly.
Ask yourself: “Is this the only time or one of many?”
Remember, even small gifts can add up over time.
Avoid frequently giving or receiving gifts or entertainment, particularly when it involves the same customer or business partner.
Ask yourself: “How might this look to an independent observer?”
Gifts and entertainment should help build goodwill and trust in a business relationship and must never represent an attempt to affect the recipient’s independent judgment.
Giving gifts or providing entertainment to gain a business advantage is always inappropriate, regardless of the value.
